thread.title: Southwest Airlines union mechanics want federal mediation
thread.title_full: Southwest Airlines union mechanics want federal mediation

author: Ben Miller
title: Southwest Airlines union mechanics want federal mediation
text: Southwest Airlines union mechanics want federal mediation Jul 7, 2015, 7:52am MDT AMFA photo The Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association (AMFA), which is based in Aurora, wants aâ€¦ more The union that represents about 2,100 aircraft mechanics at Southwest Airlines wants a federal mediator to get involved with its contract negotiations with the airline. The Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association, which is based in Aurora, said the airline "refuses to have meaningful negotiations" with the union, which has been in contract negotiations with the airline for the past three years. "When we started these negotiations we anticipated that we would reach a tentative agreement and the negotiations would conclude in a reasonable timeframe, especially in light of the unprecedented profits being enjoyed by Southwest Airlines, which our members play a significant role in achieving. Unfortunately, this has not been the case," Louie Key , the union's national director, said in a statement and a letter he wrote to Southwest CEO Gary Kelly . Home of the Day
